verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the eleventh year, in the first day of the month, that the word of the LORD came unto me, saying,
verses.web: In the eleventh year, in the first of the month, LORD’s word came to me, saying,
verses.ct: On the 1st day of the month in the 11th year, the word of the LORD came to me:

verses.kjv: Son of man, because that Tyrus hath said against Jerusalem, Aha, she is broken that was the gates of the people: she is turned unto me: I shall be replenished, now she is laid waste:
verses.web: “Son of man, because Tyre has said against Jerusalem, ‘Aha! She is broken! She who was the gateway of the peoples has been returned to me. I will be replenished, now that she is laid waste;’
verses.ct: "Son of man, Tyre has gloated over Jerusalem, saying, 'The gateway of nations is shattered! Now all that trade will flow to me. I'll grow rich now that she's been destroyed.'

verses.kjv: Therefore thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I am against thee, O Tyrus, and will cause many nations to come up against thee, as the sea causeth his waves to come up.
verses.web: therefore the Lord LORD says, ‘Behold, I am against you, Tyre, and will cause many nations to come up against you, as the sea causes its waves to come up.
verses.ct: Because of this, the Lord GOD says: 'I am against you, Tyre. I will send many nations crashing against you, one after another, like waves pounding the shore.

verses.kjv: And they shall destroy the walls of Tyrus, and break down her towers: I will also scrape her dust from her, and make her like the top of a rock.
verses.web: They will destroy the walls of Tyre, and break down her towers. I will also scrape her dust from her, and make her a bare rock.
verses.ct: They will tear down your walls and demolish your towers. I will scrape away even your rubble and leave you as nothing but bare rock.

verses.kjv: It shall be a place for the spreading of nets in the midst of the sea: for I have spoken it, saith the Lord GOD: and it shall become a spoil to the nations.
verses.web: She will be a place for the spreading of nets in the middle of the sea; for I have spoken it,’ says the Lord LORD. ‘She will become plunder for the nations.
verses.ct: You will become an empty rock in the middle of the sea where fishermen spread their nets. I have spoken,' declares the Lord GOD. 'You will be plundered by the nations.

verses.kjv: And her daughters which are in the field shall be slain by the sword; and they shall know that I am the LORD.
verses.web: Her daughters who are in the field will be slain with the sword. Then they will know that I am LORD.’
verses.ct: Your surrounding settlements on the mainland will be cut down by the sword. Then they will know that I am the LORD.'

verses.kjv: For thus saith the Lord GOD; Behold, I will bring upon Tyrus Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon, a king of kings, from the north, with horses, and with chariots, and with horsemen, and companies, and much people.
verses.web: “For the Lord LORD says: ‘Behold, I will bring on Tyre Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, king of kings, from the north, with horses, with chariots, with horsemen, and an army with many people.
verses.ct: For the Lord GOD says: 'I am bringing Nebuchadrezzar king of Babylon against Tyre — the king of kings — from the north, with horses, chariots, cavalry, and a massive army.

verses.kjv: He shall slay with the sword thy daughters in the field: and he shall make a fort against thee, and cast a mount against thee, and lift up the buckler against thee.
verses.web: He will kill your daughters in the field with the sword. He will make forts against you, cast up a mound against you, and raise up the buckler against you.
verses.ct: He will slaughter your mainland settlements with the sword. He will build siege walls against you, pile up ramps, and raise shields in formation against you.

verses.kjv: And he shall set engines of war against thy walls, and with his axes he shall break down thy towers.
verses.web: He will set his battering engines against your walls, and with his axes he will break down your towers.
verses.ct: He will aim his battering rams at your walls and smash your towers apart with his axes.

verses.kjv: By reason of the abundance of his horses their dust shall cover thee: thy walls shall shake at the noise of the horsemen, and of the wheels, and of the chariots, when he shall enter into thy gates, as men enter into a city wherein is made a breach.
verses.web: By reason of the abundance of his horses, their dust will cover you. Your walls will shake at the noise of the horsemen, of the wagons, and of the chariots, when he enters into your gates, as men enter into a city which is broken open.
verses.ct: His horses will be so many that their dust will cover you like a cloud. Your walls will shake from the thunder of cavalry, wagons, and chariots as he storms through your gates — the way soldiers pour into a city whose walls have been breached.

verses.kjv: With the hoofs of his horses shall he tread down all thy streets: he shall slay thy people by the sword, and thy strong garrisons shall go down to the ground.
verses.web: He will tread down all your streets with the hoofs of his horses. He will kill your people with the sword. The pillars of your strength will go down to the ground.
verses.ct: His horses' hooves will trample every street. He will cut down your people with the sword, and your mighty pillars will come crashing to the ground.

verses.kjv: And they shall make a spoil of thy riches, and make a prey of thy merchandise: and they shall break down thy walls, and destroy thy pleasant houses: and they shall lay thy stones and thy timber and thy dust in the midst of the water.
verses.web: They will make a plunder of your riches, and make a prey of your merchandise. They will break down your walls, and destroy your pleasant houses. They will lay your stones, your timber, and your dust in the middle of the waters.
verses.ct: His forces will loot your wealth and carry off your merchandise. They will demolish your walls and tear down your beautiful homes, then dump your stones, timber, and rubble into the sea.

verses.kjv: And I will cause the noise of thy songs to cease; and the sound of thy harps shall be no more heard.
verses.web: I will cause the noise of your songs to cease. The sound of your harps won’t be heard any more.
verses.ct: I will silence your joyful songs. The music of your harps will never be heard again.

verses.kjv: And I will make thee like the top of a rock: thou shalt be a place to spread nets upon; thou shalt be built no more: for I the LORD have spoken it, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: I will make you a bare rock. You will be a place for the spreading of nets. You will be built no more; for I LORD have spoken it,’ says the Lord LORD.
verses.ct: I will turn you into bare rock — nothing but a place for fishermen to spread their nets. You will never be rebuilt, because I, the LORD, have spoken,' declares the Lord GOD.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the Lord GOD to Tyrus; Shall not the isles shake at the sound of thy fall, when the wounded cry, when the slaughter is made in the midst of thee?
verses.web: “The Lord LORD says to Tyre: ‘Won’t the islands shake at the sound of your fall, when the wounded groan, when the slaughter is made within you?
verses.ct: The Lord GOD says to Tyre: 'Won't the coastlands tremble at the sound of your collapse — at the groans of the wounded, at the slaughter raging inside your walls?

verses.kjv: Then all the princes of the sea shall come down from their thrones, and lay away their robes, and put off their broidered garments: they shall clothe themselves with trembling; they shall sit upon the ground, and shall tremble at every moment, and be astonished at thee.
verses.web: Then all the princes of the sea will come down from their thrones, and lay aside their robes, and strip off their embroidered garments. They will clothe themselves with trembling. They will sit on the ground, and will tremble every moment, and be astonished at you.
verses.ct: Every ruler along the coast will step down from his throne, remove his royal robes, and strip off his embroidered garments. They will dress themselves in terror instead. They will sit on the ground, shaking without stopping, stunned at what has happened to you.

verses.kjv: And they shall take up a lamentation for thee, and say to thee, How art thou destroyed, that wast inhabited of seafaring men, the renowned city, which wast strong in the sea, she and her inhabitants, which cause their terror to be on all that haunt it!
verses.web: They will take up a lamentation over you, and tell you, “How you are destroyed, who were inhabited by seafaring men, the renowned city, who was strong in the sea, she and her inhabitants, who caused their terror to be on all who lived there!”
verses.ct: They will raise a funeral song over you and say: "How you have been destroyed — you famous city, once mighty on the sea! You and your people struck fear into everyone around you!"

verses.kjv: Now shall the isles tremble in the day of thy fall; yea, the isles that are in the sea shall be troubled at thy departure.
verses.web: Now the islands will tremble in the day of your fall. Yes, the islands that are in the sea will be dismayed at your departure.’
verses.ct: The coastlands will tremble on the day you fall. The islands across the sea will be shaken by your end.'

verses.kjv: For thus saith the Lord GOD; When I shall make thee a desolate city, like the cities that are not inhabited; when I shall bring up the deep upon thee, and great waters shall cover thee;
verses.web: “For the Lord LORD says: ‘When I make you a desolate city, like the cities that are not inhabited; when I bring up the deep on you, and the great waters cover you;
verses.ct: For the Lord GOD says: 'When I turn you into a deserted ruin, like cities where no one lives anymore — when I bring the ocean depths surging over you and the great waters swallow you —

verses.kjv: When I shall bring thee down with them that descend into the pit, with the people of old time, and shall set thee in the low parts of the earth, in places desolate of old, with them that go down to the pit, that thou be not inhabited; and I shall set glory in the land of the living;
verses.web: then I will bring you down with those who descend into the pit, to the people of old time, and will make you dwell in the lower parts of the earth, in the places that are desolate of old, with those who go down to the pit, that you be not inhabited; and I will set glory in the land of the living.
verses.ct: then I will drag you down into the pit with those who have gone to the grave long ago. I will make you dwell in the depths of the earth, in ancient ruins, alongside the dead — so that you will never again be inhabited. Meanwhile, I will set glory in the land of the living.

verses.kjv: I will make thee a terror, and thou shalt be no more: though thou be sought for, yet shalt thou never be found again, saith the Lord GOD.
verses.web: I will make you a terror, and you will no more have any being. Though you are sought for, yet you will never be found again,’ says the Lord LORD.”
verses.ct: I will make you an object of horror, and you will cease to exist. People will search for you, but you will never be found again,' declares the Lord GOD.
